document.title: Kentucky Academic Standards: Reading and Writing

D6DF828FD475478FB10F2951E4F95EAF.description: Demonstrate an understanding of verbs and adjectives and their synonyms.

03D64D7C8B504BFDBC9CA8CD7A8264DD.description: Demonstrate an understanding of verbs and adjectives and their antonyms.

1085666437174C52B6C6AA390C352C49.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

7A0974AA1ED849E797D60B6D4BDC1E64.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

9F22AFA5B450435CAC7780130DE08896.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

64CAE35099BF4B5B803209F94F40D782.description: Identify common affixes and how they change the meaning of a word.

042318B98C874E80A0D0A737FA840C5A.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

0EDC903905F14BF09B017C2ED858E6EA.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

193ACCF129C349169DFD31D5276E80BC.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds.

FA27ACE224294BD9AE1194C0C2C62904.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

5D610F37828E4FDFBC7C0E9F9C1F92F1.description: interrogative sentences using who, what, where, when, why and how.

EF43C4957D964DF784C074852652D008.description: regular plural nouns by orally adding /s/ or /es/.

44F11E1B5DD34215A4466C71ADC51802.description: When writing or speaking, demonstrate appropriate use of:

61B34C2DC16149A9A81C43644A53C3CA.description: With guidance and support, collect information from real-world experiences or provided sources to answer or generate questions.

C30B58575652423EBF05CA6960FD7D3C.description: With guidance and support, participate in shared research and writing projects.

0761362B5D964452B7AC5329C29CFA36.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

24E3858475994D82A069317EB44F9191.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital resources to create and publish products, including in collaboration with peers.

85C39DCB61474C309850A5C2BCABFCF2.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising and editing.

D8711DE469494601B462A4F99F7BA4F2.description: Include details which describe actions, thoughts, emotions.

AC474C4D025F4D3883DCD44F9FA0EA73.description: With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose.

7D8A7077509045FA96A43D75210E74CF.description: Compose narratives, using a combination of drawing, dictating, writing and digital resources, to develop real or imagined experiences or multiple events or ideas, using effective technique, descriptive de-tails and clear sequences.

BBF61E7C959B4C49B00A39F1B8413FEF.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising and editing.

320FB921FEA34D6EAB517EFA5ABA9414.description: Use grade-appropriate transitions to develop text structure across paragraphs.

13EC6D6038C844CE81B4A0411DEBEADD.description: Use grade-appropriate conjunctions to develop text structure within sentences.

A963CDE0C05E4FEEB7975994EE65E8E7.description: Supply information to develop the topic.

9ABF2AA8058E47C79FA44CF7E6926ED1.description: With guidance and support from adults, strengthen writing through peer collaboration and adding details through writing and/or pictures as needed.

6794E81F670C49D99D462689C5D2B0D2.description: Compose informative and/or explanatory texts, using a combination of drawing, dictating, writing and digital resources, to establish a topic and supply information about the topic.

E76E87B0DDAF43E4A7E1D7420DA8DC3D.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising and editing.

259FAED7F8C844BF9AECC9CDC37875FD.description: Provide reasons with details to support the opinion.

7E97944D3B1F4A849FE29CE0F0EF3E2F.description: With guidance and support from adults, strengthen writing through peer collaboration and adding details through writing and/or pictures as needed.

BB86CC097E8D422A83568721FE9F64DB.description: Compose opinion pieces, using a combination of drawing, dictating, writing and digital resources, to state the topic and an opinion.

40695982CDFE459195CC8BFFDC245B41.description: Print all upper and lowercase letters and numerals.

E87119902BF3464EBB0528EAFC6ABD51.description: With prompting and support, flexibly use a variety of comprehension strategies (i.e., questioning, monitoring, visualizing, inferencing, summarizing, using prior knowledge, determining importance) to make sense of grade-level appropriate, complex informational texts.

223DF84686D24F5B99B9EC9DD94851A8.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

082363C191DE40178AAF4F569BA36EDF.description: With prompting and support, identify information from two or more texts on similar themes or topics.

51005FA38703447D9040C642FB416136.description: With prompting and support, identify the claim and the reasons an author gives to support claims in a text.

F76C958A6875496788863C1E780E24A5.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between visuals and the text.

C9CFA6D8FF154B79A4B8EFEC1F352BF3.description: With prompting and support, identify the author and illustrator of a text, and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

F9A9461F5E1D40658201298A42F8BC05.description: Identify the front cover, back cover and title page of a book.

A697136D3CD34961BD222A41CABDD382.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

4D415892AA8D4CD4BA23AFE776CC8664.description: With prompting and support, identify the individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information presented over the course of a text.

B457730EDAC74F9399C17D946E4CEC58.description: With prompting and support, orally recognize key details from a summary to demonstrate understanding of the central idea of a text.

A8380DC974BD44E899D9F89F60CF7A0A.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer explicit questions about key concepts and details, and make logical inferences to construct meaning from the text.

8E74AC4979624A46B5AD263B077EA703.description: With prompting and support, flexibly use a variety of comprehension strategies (i.e., questioning, monitoring, visualizing, inferencing, summarizing, using prior knowledge, determining importance) to make sense of grade-level appropriate, complex literary texts.

585EE4DA98FF4E34968BEE95AB940163.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

79D8111002EE4BD3A8BC2B17296974E2.description: With prompting and support, compare/contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in stories.

D0C66221D44643378B9C3F0A1BD5B023.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear.

ED48B61960404CEFB2476A58A113DA1C.description: With prompting and support, identify the author and illustrator of a story and explain how each tells the story.

815A5011F55946D9AA15256B3C793C5D.description: Recognize common structures of poems, stories and dramas.

2AA7878D59614A3CA4BFAA89FC983EEE.description: With prompting and support, identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

F33BBCA6B84D43D5A3FD58E8DAEF67DF.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings and major events in a story in order to make meaning of the story development.

FA16059A3183470A94EB912361EBEBE2.description: With prompting and support, orally recognize key details from a summary to demonstrate understanding of the lesson learned in the story.

3681C63A60FB4CA9923F0ED537833806.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer explicit questions about key ideas and details, and make logical inferences to construct meaning from the text.

A587F90A10994CC88560F432DDE542F0.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

3C47DC9BFFF646A1B6798C9CAE0BE317.description: Read fluently (accuracy, speed, and prosody) on grade-level to support comprehension.

F836171BD35F4CEB95E5CA8B8EEFFC19.description: Orally distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

C5BB478023964A8E816F3814D9B3D72F.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight.

BAFF17CD55D147A0823D7F4BD07ADFE3.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

75771166CF7541A7B41DD27214F564FC.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

9BA3370CCC234266955A1B0818A2068E.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

A25939217B0445F3BE83032677216C4E.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

300F3F5190F04411B4BEDBE43350C32B.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme words.

77B1061C4C364C7D9829D6AD7953172D.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

A7B2A566F8354FC8831FDA3DF41F575C.description: Count, pronounce, blend and segment syllables in spoken words.

25BAFA8F5AF740B5B47FCB774CA76663.description: Recognize and orally produce rhyming words.

F846F041240B47C199523FD657FF4C94.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables and sounds (phonemes).

7085A4403FC64A14A6B20976951F58D8.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

4FC7D5BEC54F487C9C2BE8AE0717EA95.description: Recognize that words are separated by spaces in print.

B557DA883EDD4D44A9D36FE7359B6EB2.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

649800A43CB84554AFB3900F9677DF9D.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom and page by page.

CC582AE144994B6CAFE1886FE0183DAC.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print to aid in comprehension.
